alert.note: Alert for Copiah; Franklin; Lawrence; Lincoln; Marion (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 9:24PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SIMPSON...NORTHWESTERN MARION... LINCOLN...LAWRENCE...SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN AND EASTERN COPIAH COUNTIES THROUGH 1030 PM CST... At 924 PM CST, emergency management reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Whites to near Little Springs. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Brookhaven, Hazlehurst, Wesson, Beauregard, Georgetown, Mccall Creek, Hopewell, Center Point, West Lincoln, and Martinsville around 930 PM CST. Braxton around 935 PM CST. Rockport and Union around 940 PM CST. Bogue Chitto around 945 PM CST. D`Lo, Sontag, Oma, and Enterprise around 950 PM CST. Mendenhall and Pinola around 955 PM CST. East Lincoln, Shivers, and Wanilla around 1000 PM CST. New Hebron around 1005 PM CST. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CST for south central and southwestern Mississippi.
